Posts.Content: May 10, 2017 09:09AM Sem83 wrote: So I had my appointment with a breast surgeon for a second opinion. The breast surgeon looked at all my mammograms and ultrasounds, examined me and asked me a bunch of questions about my pain. She said that she is sure that¬†my pain is caused by¬†"Costochondritis" which¬†is an inflammation of the junctions where the upper ribs join¬†with the cartilage that¬†holds them to the breastbone.¬†I looked it up and I have all the symptoms that are listed for this.¬†¬†She also said she doesn't see a reason to refer me to have a mri done. I picked up some Celebrex¬†from the pharmacy¬†and slowed down on lifting weights. I really hope this is it for me!

Posts.Title: Pain in left breast got worse Sem83 Moderators

Posts.Content: Sem83 wrote: So in 2015 I started having this on and off pain in my left breast (10:30 position). I had a Mammogram and ultrasound done and no findings. Pain went away and came back late 2016. I went back for Mammogram and ultrasound and no findings on Mammogram but on the ultrasound they found¬†1 3mm cyst and 7mm clusters of micro cysts (Birad-2) exactly where I feel the pain. Breast surgeon advised me to stay away from caffeine and salt. She added that the cysts are too small to be drained. I cut caffeine out and try to watch my salt intake. Now here we are in 2017 and my breast pain got worse. I feel the pain, which feels like a burning pain, everyday now. I want to add that I do weight lifting at the gym and that's when I feel it the most. Basically any movement I do with my left arm. It can be something as simple as stretching my left¬†arm to wash my hair. I do not feel the pain (which is still in that exact 10:30 position) when I'm just sitting down or laying down. I do have an ultrasound scheduled again next week (last one was 7 month ago) and I'm really scared to find out what it is and why the pain got worse. At the same time I don't want to be brushed again without knowing what is causing the burning pain in that one spot! I just can't see tiny cysts hurting this bad unless they got bigger! I'm open to any feedback or ideas what this could be? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pain in left breast got worse Sem83 Moderators

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2017 09:05PM Sem83 wrote: Thank you for your reply djmammo! I have posted my last report. I am keeping my appointment next week but I'm slightly nervous. So I am also trying to "test" how often I feel that burning pain throughout the day if I limit movements with my arms. I basically stopped lifting weights starting this past Tuesday and I'm trying to only use my right arm for anything that I need to pick up or stretch. And it's interesting that i have not felt the pain Tuesday and Wednesday.

Posts.Title: Skin pulling and lump bowoky MTwoman

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2017 03:50AM Sem83 wrote: So I just got done with my appointment. When I first got there the lady at the front desk informed that the radiologist wanted to have a mammogram done with the scheduled ultrasound. First they did the mammogram and then had me in the waiting area to wait for the ultrasound. About 30 min later the lady from mammogram comes back and says the radiologist wants more pictures. I'm not going to lie but I got really scared at that point. So went ahead and did more imaging. I asked her why he wanted more imaging and then she pointed at one of the images and pointed to an area. She said he wanted to check that area. Next was the ultrasound. The ultrasound tech informed me that the radiologist wanted to do the ultrasound himself. That was different. At that point I was pretty sure something is wrong. He then came in and said that the mammogram was ok. And that he will do the ultrasound on the area that is painful. He checked and even went on the area that I was feeling sore. And the only thing that was visible was the same cyst from last time-same size 3mm! So he doesn't think it is the tiny cyst that's causing the pain. He says it could be my dense tissue?! And that I could check with my doctor to see if the pain is coming from a muscle or my shoulder?! I do feel relieved that he didn't find no abnormalities. But still not sure what to think of it.
